messages.message:
Hi team,

When doing our 24.01 upgrade of our SaaS environments, we faced some deployment issues/failures due to missing patchesâ€”patches that hadn't been backported from the master to the release branches. We are brainstroming on ideas for automatically check for missing backports. Does anyone have suggestions on this?

cc: @jayapandian.ponraj @anmol.agrawal
Prevent people from manually adding patches, and require that merge to master + CI pipeline instead?

These are not manually added patches Matt.. These are infact mergd to master but were not backported to the release branch.
Probably ppl are missing the newest release backport as they may not be aware that the new release branch is available. Thats my guess..

What defines a missing backport though? There are going to be some patched that only need to be on master and not release branches? Or are you saying somehow when a new release branch is created we need to look for all the patches on master and move them all over to the new release branch?

The details are captured in the upgrade retro - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1a8B-wbuH7N6Uwa20HfwcXu7yyjJeahUAyG5wWdofdcE/edit
may be that will give better insights.
cc: @Rahul
